summary_md: This round corrected and consolidated structural identities for the family M = Z + L − U. We verified the continuant recurrence and explicit a_{k,1..3}; computed boundary entries α_n, α_{n+1}, α_{n+2} with the exact formula (M^{n+2})_{n,1}=h_3−(n+1)e_1+(z_1+z_n) (so under e_1=0 one gets e_3=−(z_1+z_n) but not z_1+z_n=0). Low-order traces were derived (tr(M^2), tr(M^3), tr(M^4)) and tr(A^4)=6n−10. The λ^{n−4} coefficient was written c_{n−4}=e_4+Q+C(n−2,2) and shown (under nilpotency) to be equivalent to tr(M^4)=0 (hence not independent). New weighted tools were recorded: tr(WM), tr(WM^2), tr(WM^3), a weighted Laplacian identity and kernel summation-by-parts for v∈ker M. Main remaining gap: none of the identities yet exploit the weighted constraint ∑ i z_i=0 decisively. Next work should target W-based traces or (M^{n+3})_{n,1} and kernel/peeling methods to force endpoint elimination and an induction. Citations: proofs.md; Research Notes (corrected & consolidated).
one_line_summary: Low-order identities and weighted traces derived; need W-based tools to exploit ∑ i z_i=0
highlights: Continuant recurrence and explicit a_{k,1..3} verified; boundary entries α_n, α_{n+1}, α_{n+2} computed.
Exact identity: (M^{n+2})_{n,1}=h_3−(n+1)e_1+(z_1+z_n); under e_1=0 this gives e_3=−(z_1+z_n) (no forced z_1+z_n=0).
Closed-form traces obtained: tr(M^2), tr(M^3), tr(M^4) with tr(A^4)=6n−10.
λ^{n−4} coefficient c_{n−4}=e_4+Q+C(n−2,2) derived; under nilpotency c_{n−4}=0 ⇔ tr(M^4)=0 (redundant).
Weighted tools added: tr(WM), tr(WM^2), tr(WM^3), weighted Laplacian identity, and kernel summation-by-parts for v∈ker M.
Critical gap: current identities do not yet leverage the weighted constraint ∑ i z_i=0 in a decisive way.
next_questions: Derive (M^{n+3})_{n,1} explicitly (with multiplicities) and check whether an independent index-weighted term ∑ i z_i appears.
Compute tr(W M^4) (and reverify tr(W M^3)), then combine weighted traces with tr(M^2)=tr(M^3)=tr(M^4)=0 to isolate boundary variables and attempt edge-peeling.
Develop/use the kernel summation-by-parts or Green’s-function approach for Mv=0 together with ∑ i z_i=0 to force endpoint relations (aim: z_1=z_n=0) and then prove a Schur-complement peeling lemma.
